name: Alter
title: Void Breacher

tactical.name: Void Passage
tactical.description: Create a portal on either side of any surface that’s under 25m thick.

passive.name: Gift from the Rift
passive.description: See death boxes through walls and take an item from them.

ultimate.name: Void Nexus
ultimate.description: Spawn a device which your squad can go back to through a portal.

backstory.early_life: Alter is a dimension-hopping void breacher with a destructive, enigmatic personality. Her real past is unknown due to her living multiple lives as a result of her void-related abilities.
backstory.career_before_games: She hops from world to world, searching for places where she can unleash her powers, taking down anyone and anything that stands in her path.
backstory.joining_apex: Alter joined the Apex Games in Season 21, bringing her unique void manipulation abilities to the arena.

fun_facts: First playable Legend of Chinese descent.

name: Horizon
title: Gravitational Manipulator

tactical.name: Gravity Lift
tactical.description: Reverses the flow of gravity, lifting players upwards and boosting them outwards when they exit.

passive.name: Spacewalk
passive.description: Increase air control and reduce fall impacts with Horizon’s custom spacesuit.

ultimate.name: Black Hole
ultimate.description: Deploy N.E.W.T. to create a micro black hole that pulls players in towards it, and hits them with a graviton blast at the end.

backstory.early_life: Dr. Mary Somers, a charmingly eccentric astrophysicist, was hired to find a solution to the Outlands' energy crisis.
backstory.career_before_games: With the help of her apprentice, Dr. Reid, Mary discovered Branthium. Betrayed and stranded near a black hole, she returned 87 years later due to time dilation.
backstory.joining_apex: Determined to fund her research to find a way to go back in time and be with her son, she joins the Apex Games as Horizon.

personality.insecurities: Guilt over leaving her son behind.

fun_facts: Her robotic companion is named N.E.W.T.
Returned to Olympus just in time for the next season to debut there.

name: Mirage
title: The Holographic Trickster

tactical.name: Psyche Out
tactical.description: Sends out a holographic decoy to confuse enemies.

passive.name: Now You See Me...
passive.description: Automatically cloaks when using Respawn Beacons and reviving teammates.

ultimate.name: Life of the Party
ultimate.description: Deploys a team of controllable decoys to distract enemies.

mother.name: Evelyn Witt
mother.notes: Suffers from dementia; shares a close bond with Elliott.

brothers.name: Elon Witt
brothers.note: Went missing after the Crimson crashed on Gaea.

brothers.name: Ricky Witt
brothers.note: Went missing after the Crimson crashed on Gaea.

brothers.name: Roger Witt
brothers.note: Went missing after the Crimson crashed on Gaea.

backstory.early_life: Born on Solace, Elliott was the youngest of four brothers. After his father left and his brothers went missing during the Outlands Civil War, he bonded with his mother and helped her with holographic technology.
backstory.mother_relationship: Mirage remained close to his mother, even using holograms to comfort her after his brothers were lost. He feared his creations may have worsened her memory issues, but she reassured him.
backstory.career_before_games: Worked multiple jobs including as a water treatment plant night manager. Later bought and ran the Paradise Lounge, a bar his brother dreamed of opening.
backstory.joining_apex: Encouraged by his mother, who gifted him custom holo devices, he entered the Apex Games to gain fame and fortune.

personality.insecurities: Feels lonely, fears being forgotten or unloved, as seen in his dating profile.
hobbies: Playing piano (e.g., 'The Inch Worm' for his mother)

notable_quotes: I'm not afraid of heights. I'm afraid of falling... and dying.
I make things look good. Literally, that's my job.
fun_facts: Owns a bar called Paradise Lounge on Solace.
Has fake merchandise like 'Witt's Whiskey' and 'Witt's Bamboozles Cereal'.
